title: MLB Network
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is authenticated to view MLB Network in the app 

(Optimum: research38/support38)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched the MLB Network (MLBN) feed 
(More Menu > MLB Network)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a button for Picture-in-Picture (PiP) in the media controls in the top left corner, next to the X button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the PiP button in the media controls
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLBN stream will pop out into a smaller window (PiP mode)
with no interruption to playback
and the user will be able to navigate throughout the app, while still viewing the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the PiP video should have the following playback controls:
Full Screen
Pause
Dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
and taps the Full Screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will return to full screen 
with no interruption to playback

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
and taps the Pause button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video will pause in PiP mode

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
and the video has been paused
and taps the Play button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video playback will resume in PiP mode

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
and taps the X button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the PiP video will dismiss

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
and backgrounds At Bat
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the PiP video will continue to play while the user navigates the device home screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is viewing MLBN in PiP mode
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be able to move the PiP video around the device screen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched the MLBN stream in full screen
and taps the device home button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video should pop out into PiP mode
with no interruption to playback

title: Portrait, Landscape, and PiP
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user selects a VOD from various sections of the app (MLB team page Videos section)
AND the user taps on the video to bring up the video player
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the video player maximize button while remaining in Portrait
custom_expected: THEN the user will enter full-screen (Landscape)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the PiP button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video player will resume in PiP mode while still in portrait

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user Maximizes the PiP video by tapping on the full-screen button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the video will continue while device remains in Portrait

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user views the video player
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN No issues will have been found regarding changing the state of Portrait > Landscape > PiP > Back to Portrait

title: SVOD - Backgrounding App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to the EPG page
AND the user is on the Watch section 
AND the user is on the Featured tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on an SVOD in the Featured section
AND the video player begins playback in landscape
AND the user enters PiP by swiping to the home screen (Backgrounding app)
custom_expected: THEN the user will see the SVOD content play in PiP mode while the user navigates through their phone

title: SVOD - Returning from PiP (backgrounding)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to the EPG page
AND the user is on the Watch section
AND the user is on the Featured tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on an SVOD in the Featured section
AND the video player begins playback in landscape
AND the user launches PiP via the PiP button on the player controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user can tap on the full-screen icon on the PiP video 
AND the user will be brought back into the app
AND the video will continue playback in landscape mode without any issues (App closing or crash)

title: SVOD - Launching via PiP Button
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to the EPG page
AND the user is on the Watch section
AND the user is on the Featured tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on an SVOD in the Featured section
AND the video player begins playback in landscape
AND the user launches PiP via the PiP button on the player controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see the PiP video player enabled over the app 
AND the user can navigate through the app as the video continues to play

title: SVOD - Returning from PiP (PiP button)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user navigates to the EPG page
AND the user is on the Watch section
AND the user is on the Featured tab
custom_steps:
WHEN the user taps on an SVOD in the Featured section
AND the video player begins playback in landscape
AND the user launches PiP by swiping and backgrounding the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user can tap on the full-screen icon on the PiP video 
AND the user will be brought back into the app
AND the video will continue playback in landscape mode without any issues (App closing or crash)

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP Button
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps: When the user has launched a MLB.TV feed
custom_expected: Then the user will see a button for Picture-in-Picture (PiP) in the media controls in the top left corner, next to the X button

title: MLB.TV live->  Tapping PIP Button in Media Controls
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
and the user has launched a MLB.TV feed
and the user will see a button for Picture-in-Picture (PiP) in the media controls in the top left corner, next to the X button
custom_steps: When the user taps the PiP button in the media controls
custom_expected:
Then the video will pop out into a smaller window (PiP mode)
with no interruption to playback
and the user will be able to navigate throughout the app, while still viewing the feed

title: MLB.TV live-> User Viewing Video in PIP Mode
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps: When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
custom_expected:
Then the PiP video should have the following playback controls:
* Full Screen
* Pause
* Dismiss

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP Full Screen -> Return to Full Screen
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
and taps the Full Screen button
custom_expected:
Then the video will return to full screen
with no interruption to playback

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP Mode -> Pause Button
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
and taps the Pause button
custom_expected: Then the video will pause in PiP mode

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP in Pause State -> User Taps Play Button
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
and the user has tapped the pause button while viewing video in PIP mode
custom_steps: When the user taps the play button
custom_expected: Then the video playback will resume in PiP mode

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP Mode -> X Button Dismisses
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
and taps the X button
custom_expected: Then the PiP video will dismiss

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP Mode Backgrounded -> PIP Continues to Play
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
and backgrounds At Bat
custom_expected: Then the PiP video will continue to play while the user navigates the device home screen

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP -> Moving PIP Video Around Device Screen
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
custom_steps: When the user is viewing a video in PiP mode
custom_expected: Then the user will be able to move the PiP video around the device screen

title: MLB.TV live -> PIP -> User taps home button
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
and the user is playing video via PIP
custom_steps:
When the user has launched a MLB.TV feed in full screen
and taps the device home button
custom_expected:
Then the video should pop out into PiP mode
with no interruption to playback

title: Portrait, Landscape, and PiP (1)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user selects a VOD from various sections of the app (MLB team page Videos section)
AND the user taps on the video to bring up the video player
And the user taps on the video player maximize button while remaining in Portrait
And the user will enter full-screen (Landscape)
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on the PiP button
custom_expected: THEN the video player will resume in PiP mode while still in portrait

title: Portrait, Landscape, and PiP (2)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user selects a VOD from various sections of the app (MLB team page Videos section)
AND the user taps on the video to bring up the video player
And the user taps on the video player maximize button while remaining in Portrait
And the user will enter full-screen (Landscape)
And the user taps on the PiP button
And the video player will resume in PiP mode while still in portrait
custom_steps: WHEN the user Maximizes the PiP video by tapping on the full-screen button
custom_expected: THEN the video will continue while device remains in Portrait

title: MLB Highlights -> Enabling PIP -During Video Playback in Playlist View
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
and User has navigated to Highlights 
and Video Playback has started
custom_steps: When user taps PIP button
custom_expected:
Then the PIP video will move to the lower left hand part of the page 
And the video playing from the highlight playlist view will stop playing

title: MLB Highlights -> Enabling PIP -During Full View Video Playback
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iOS device
and the user is logged in with a MLB.TV entitled account
and User has navigated to Highlights
and the user has started playing video in full screen mode
custom_steps: When the user selects the PIP button
custom_expected:
The main video player will exit
and the user will be brought back to playlist view
and the PIP video will continue playing in lower left hand side of the screen
